name: Yixin Chen 0001
content: Yixin Chen | WashU McKelvey School of Engineering Education PhD, University of Illinois, 2005MSc, University of Illinois, 2001BSc, University of Science and Technology of China, 1999 Expertise Develops algorithms to extract knowledge from massive amount of data Research Yixin Chen's research interests are in the general areas of AI and machine learning. He is particularly interested in graph learning, large language models, foundation models, and their applications. Biography In September 2005, Professor Chen joined the faculty at Washington University in St. Louis. He has a number of awards including the Microsoft Research New Faculty Fellowship and the Department of Energy Early Career Principal Investigator Award. Professor Chen also serves his professional societies as a programming committee member, fund reviewer and National Science Foundation review panelist. He is a Fellow of AAAI and IEEE. In the News Chen receives St. Louis Innovator Award from St. Louis Bar Association The award recognizes his innovation and entrepreneurship. 01.28.2025 Chen elected Fellow of the Association for the Advancement of Artificial Intelligence Yixin Chen is the first from WashU to be elected a fellow. 01.21.2025 Grant funds green fertilizer research at WashU DOE awards $5 million to develop technology to convert atmospheric nitrogen into fertilizer. 10.23.2023 Find more news about Yixin Chen
